meanings.definition: Extremely odd or eccentric in a humorous or amusing way.
meanings.sent1: The clown's costume was the whackiest outfit at the party.
meanings.sent2: Her whackiest idea was to wear mismatched socks to the formal event.
meanings.sent3: The whackiest thing happened when the dog started dancing to the music.
meanings.sent4: His whackiest dream involved flying on a giant marshmallow through the sky.
meanings.sent5: The whackiest character in the story was a talking pineapple with sunglasses.

meanings.definition: The superlative form of 'whacky', meaning extremely strange or unconventional.
meanings.sent1: Among all the whacky inventions, the whackiest was a robot that could paint portraits.
meanings.sent2: The museum displayed the whackiest collection of abstract art from around the world.
meanings.sent3: The whackiest item in the antique shop was a clock that ran backward.
meanings.sent4: In the land of imagination, the whackiest of creatures roamed freely.
meanings.sent5: The treasure hunt led them to the whackiest treasure chest filled with glittering gems.
